revised_title: Mechanical Behavior of Large-Strain Fiber-Reinforced Composite Materials
tldr: The article presents a theory for the mechanical behavior of fiber-reinforced composite materials at large strains, based on the distribution of fibers within the material and using basic mechanical properties of the fibers and matrix. The theory predicts the reorientation of fibers with strain and shows good agreement with experimental results from spinal ligaments. It may also have applications in drawn polymers, as demonstrated with polyethylene and polyethylene terephthalate.
